<body lang="EN-US" link="blue" vlink="purple">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exhibit
99.1</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="200" height="115" src="g151381mmimage002.gif"></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="46%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:46.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AT THE COMPANY:</font></u></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="53%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:53.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AT FINANCIAL
  RELATIONS BOARD</font></u></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="46%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:46.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">John Wille &#151; Vice President &amp; CFO</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="53%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:53.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">John McNamara</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="46%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:46.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">201-337-9000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="53%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:53.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">212-827-3771</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<h4 style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font style="font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></h4>

<h4 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE</font></u></b></h4>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h5 align="center" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">RUSS BERRIE AND COMPANY,
INC. ACQUIRES KIDS LINE, LLC</font></u></b></h5>

<h5 align="center" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Expands Presence in
Infant and Juvenile Product Sector</font></u></b></h5>

<h1 align="center" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h1>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Oakland,
N.J. &#151; December&nbsp;16, 2004</font></b> &#151; RUSS BERRIE AND
COMPANY, INC. (NYSE: RUS) today announced it had acquired 100% of the
membership interests of Kids Line, LLC, a leading designer and distributor of
infant bedding products based in South Gate CA.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company paid approximately $128 million cash for the privately held
Kids Line.&#160; The Company entered into a
senior secured financing facility in the amount of $125 million with Ableco
Finance LLC in order to fund the purchase.&#160;
The purchase price is subject to certain post closing adjustments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">An additional secured subordinated contingent payment obligation to
certain sellers of Kids Line membership interests may become payable at the end
of three years based on the cumulative EBITDA of Kids Line over such three year
period as compared to a specified budget.&#160;
Kids Line&#146;s existing management team will remain in place.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Andy Gatto, CEO of Russ Berrie, commented, &#147;We are extremely excited to
add Kids Line to our current portfolio of infant and juvenile products.&#160; As we expand our presence in this vibrant
business sector, Kids Line provides a proven track record of innovation and
leadership within the juvenile bedding and accessories market.&#160; Kids Line has shown consistent growth with
its broad assortment of high value products.&#160;
Along with our Sassy&#153; and RUSS&#174; Baby&#153; brands, we believe the Kids Line
acquisition positions our Company as a leader within the juvenile products
sector.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Michael Levin, CEO of Kids Line comments, &#147;We are delighted to become
part of the Russ family and expect significant synergies with the existing
Sassy&#153; and RUSS&#174; Baby&#153; brands.&#160; Russ
Berrie&#146;s international distribution and sourcing capabilities will be of great
benefit to the Kids Line business.&#160; The
potential of the combined business is exciting to us.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font>More&#151;</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\JMS\smani\04-15138-1\task259609\15138-1-mm.htm',USER='mrnathan',CD='Dec 22 01:36 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Russ Berrie and Company, Inc. (RUSS</font>&#174;), a leader in the gift industry (and its
wholly-owned subsidiaries), designs, develops, and distributes a variety of
innovative gift products to specialty and mass market retailers worldwide.&#160; Known for its teddy bears and other plush
animals, the Company&#146;s gift line is comprised of a diverse range of everyday,
seasonal, and occasion-themed products that help people celebrate the
milestones in their lives.&#160; Founded in
1963 by the late Russ Berrie from a rented garage in New Jersey, today the
Company operates offices, showrooms, and distribution centers all over the
world and trades on the NYSE under the symbol RUS.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Note: This News Release contains certain
forward-looking statements.&#160; Additional
written and oral forward-looking statements may be made by the Company from
time to time in Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) filings and
otherwise.&#160; The Private Securities
Litigation Reform Act of 1995 provides a safe-harbor for forward-looking
statements.&#160; These statements may be
identified by the use of forward-looking words or phrases including, but not
limited to, &#147;anticipate&#148;, &#147;believe&#148;, &#147;expect&#148;, &#147;intend&#148;, &#147;may&#148;, &#147;planned&#148;, &#147;potential&#148;,
&#147;should&#148;, &#147;will&#148; or &#147;would&#148;.&#160; The Company
cautions readers that results predicted by forward-looking statements,
including, without limitation, those relating to the Company&#146;s future business
prospects, revenues, working capital, liquidity, capital needs, interest costs
and income are subject to certain risks and uncertainties that could cause
actual results to differ materially from those
indicated in the forward-looking statements.&#160;
Specific risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to, the
Company&#146;s ability to continue to manufacture its products in the Far East, the
seasonality of revenues, the actions of competitors, ability to increase
production capacity, price competition, the effects of government regulation,
results of any enforcement action by the People&#146;s Republic of China (&#147;PRC&#148;)
authorities with respect to the Company&#146;s PRC operations, the resolution of
various legal matters, possible delays in the introduction of new products,
customer acceptance of products, changes in foreign currency exchange rates,
issues related to the Company&#146;s computer systems, the ability to obtain debt
financing to fund acquisitions, the current and future outlook of the global
retail market, and other factors.</font></i></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">###</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="right" style="margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exhibit 99.2</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="202" height="115" src="g151381mqimage002.jpg"></font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.24%;">
  <p style="margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:44.46%;">
  <p style="margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AT FINANCIAL RELATIONS BOARD</font></u></b></p>

  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:52.3%;">

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.24%;">

<p style="margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE</font></u></b></h4>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">RUSS BERRIE AND COMPANY,
INC. ANNOUCE AWARD OF STOCK OPTIONS</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Oakland, N.J. &#151; December 22, 2004.</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; In accordance with Section 303A.08 of the
NYSE Listed Company Manual, Russ Berrie and Company, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) today
announced the award of stock options granted to each of (i) the President and
Chief Executive Officer and (ii) the Executive Vice President of Kids Line,
LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (&#147;Kids Line&#148;), in connection with the
Company&#146;s purchase of all of the membership interests and warrants to purchase
membership interests in Kids Line as of December 15, 2004 (the &#147;Acquisition&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is a description of the material terms
of an award of stock options to Mr. Michael Levin, as a material inducement to
Mr. Levin becoming President and Chief Executive Officer of Kids Line following
the Acquisition.&#160; In accordance with the
terms of Mr. Levin&#146;s employment agreement with Kids Line (the &#147;ML Employment
Agreement&#148;), executed in connection with the Acquisition, as of December 15,
2004, the Company granted Mr. Levin (i) a ten-year stock option under the
Company&#146;s 2004 Stock Option, Restricted and Non-Restricted Stock Plan (the &#147;2004
Plan&#148;), which plan was approved by the shareholders of the Company, to purchase
100,000 shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock (the &#147;ML Plan Option&#148;) and (ii) a
ten-year stock option outside of the 2004 Plan (due to grant limitations
therein) to purchase 100,000 shares of Company&#146;s Common Stock (the &#147;ML Non-Plan
Option&#148;), in each case with an exercise price of $22.21 per share, the closing
market price of such stock on the New York Stock Exchange on the date of
grant.&#160; Except as described below, the ML
Plan Option shall vest 33 1/3% annually over three years from the date of
grant.&#160; If the employment of Mr. Levin
under the ML Employment Agreement is terminated by Kids Line by reason of his
Disability (as defined in the ML Employment Agreement), or by reason of his
death, any outstanding unexercised portion of the ML Plan Option, whether or
not vested and/or exercisable on the date of such termination, shall be deemed
fully vested and exercisable and may be exercised by Mr. Levin&#146;s legal
representatives, estate, legatee(s) or permitted transferee(s), as applicable,
for up to one (1) year after such termination or the stated term of the ML Plan
Option, whichever period is shorter.&#160; If
the employment of Mr. Levin under the ML Employment Agreement is terminated by
Kids Line for Cause or by Mr. Levin without Good Reason (each as defined in the
ML Employment Agreement), any outstanding unexercised portion of the ML Plan
Option, whether vested or not, will be cancelled and deemed terminated as of
the date of his termination.&#160; If Mr.
Levin&#146;s employment under the ML Employment Agreement is terminated by Kids Line
without Cause or by Mr. Levin with Good Reason (each as defined in the ML
Employment Agreement), any outstanding unexercised portion of the ML Plan
Option, whether or not vested and/or exercisable on the date of such
termination, shall be deemed fully vested and exercisable and may be exercised
by Mr. Levin or his permitted transferee(s), as applicable, for up to six
months after such termination or the stated term of the ML Plan Option,
whichever period is shorter.&#160; The
provisions set forth in the last three sentences are referred to herein as the &#147;Termination
Provisions&#148;. The ML Plan Option is subject to anti-dilution and other
adjustment provisions set forth in the 2004 Plan.</font></h1>

<h1 align="center" style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></h1>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></h1>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\JMS\kmaruthi\04-15138-1\task261008\15138-1-mq.htm',USER='kksrinivasan',CD='Dec 23 02:02 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></h1>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Except as set forth below, the ML Non-Plan Option
shall vest 33 1/3% annually over three years from the date of grant.&#160; The ML Non-Plan Option is subject to the
Termination Provisions.&#160; The ML Non-Plan
Option is subject to anti-dilution and other adjustment provisions
substantially similar to those set forth in the 2004 Plan.</font></h1>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is a description of the material terms
of an award of stock options to Ms. Joanne Levin, as a material inducement to
Ms. Levin becoming Executive Vice President of Kids Line following the
Acquisition.&#160; In accordance with the
terms of Ms. Levin&#146;s employment agreement with Kids Line (the &#147;JL Employment
Agreement&#148;), executed in connection with the Acquisition, as of December 15,
2004, the Company granted Ms. Levin (i) a ten-year stock option under the 2004
Plan to purchase 100,000 shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock (the &#147;JL Plan
Option&#148;) and (ii) a ten-year stock option outside of the 2004 Plan (due to
grant limitations therein) to purchase 100,000 shares of Company&#146;s Common Stock
(the &#147;JL Non-Plan Option&#148;), in each case with an exercise price of $22.21 per
share, the closing market price of such stock on the New York Stock Exchange on
the date of grant.&#160; Except as described
below, each of the JL Plan Option and the JL Non-Plan Option shall vest 33 1/3%
annually over three years from the date of grant.&#160; Each of the JL Plan Option and the JL
Non-Plan Option is subject to the Termination Provisions.&#160; The JL Plan Option is subject to
anti-dilution and other adjustment provisions set forth in the 2004 Plan.&#160; The JL Non-Plan Option is subject to
anti-dilution and other adjustment provisions substantially similar to those
set forth in the 2004 Plan.</font></h1>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Russ Berrie and Company, Inc. (RUSS</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#174;), a leader in the gift industry (and its
wholly-owned subsidiaries), designs, develops, and distributes a variety of
innovative gift products to specialty and mass market retailers worldwide.&#160; Known for its teddy bears and other plush
animals, the Company&#146;s gift line is comprised of a diverse range of everyday,
seasonal, and occasion-themed products that help people celebrate the
milestones in their lives.&#160; Founded in
1963 by the late Russ Berrie from a rented garage in New Jersey, today the
Company operates offices, showrooms, and distribution centers all over the
world and trades on the NYSE under the symbol RUS.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Note: This News Release contains
certain forward-looking statements.&#160;
Additional written and oral forward-looking statements may be made by
the Company from time to time in Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)
filings and otherwise.&#160; The Private
Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 provides a safe-harbor for
forward-looking statements.&#160; These
statements may be identified by the use of forward-looking words or phrases
including, but not limited to, &#147;anticipate&#148;, &#147;believe&#148;, &#147;expect&#148;, &#147;intend&#148;, &#147;may&#148;,
&#147;planned&#148;, &#147;potential&#148;, &#147;should&#148;, &#147;will&#148; or &#147;would&#148;.&#160; The Company cautions readers that results
predicted by forward-looking statements, including, without limitation, those
relating to the Company&#146;s future business prospects, revenues, working capital,
liquidity, capital needs, interest costs and income are subject to certain
risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially
from those indicated in the forward-looking statements.&#160; Specific risks and uncertainties include, but
are not limited to, the Company&#146;s ability to continue to manufacture its
products in the Far East, the seasonality of revenues, the actions of
competitors, ability to increase production capacity, price competition, the
effects of government regulation, results of any enforcement action by the
People&#146;s Republic of China (&#147;PRC&#148;) authorities with respect to the Company&#146;s PRC
operations, the resolution of various legal matters, possible delays in the
introduction of new products, customer acceptance of products, changes in
foreign currency exchange rates, issues related to the Company&#146;s computer
systems, the ability to obtain debt financing to fund acquisitions, the current
and future outlook of the global retail market, and other factors.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">###</font></p>
